definition: to discern/to distinguish clearly
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to distinguish/to recognize
to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)

sentences.english: Dayu flood control have to review the Western Regions Mountain View Distinguish the flow of water.
sentences.chinese: 大禹治水也曾到西域察山观水明辨流向。

sentences.english: At what age are children able to distinguish between right and wrong?
sentences.chinese: 儿童到什么年龄才能明辨是非？

sentences.english: Child as he is, he knows right from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他是个孩子，他明辨是非。

sentences.english: Calibre from the words. It is difficult to identify and understanding.
sentences.chinese: 口径不一，各言其是，很难明辨是非和统一认识。

sentences.english: I can teach you right form wrong, but I cannot decide for you.
sentences.chinese: 我可以教你明辨是非，却不能帮你作出选择。

sentences.english: We want to distinguish between two different types of scepticism.
sentences.chinese: 我们要明辨两种不同类型的怀疑主义。

sentences.english: Some people with higher education are still unable to distinguish right from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 一些受过高等教育的人仍然不能明辨是非。

sentences.english: They are often gentle in nature, and know right from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 她们通常温柔体贴，明辨是非。

sentences.english: You have to be endowed with the human values of circumspect mindfulness and reasonable discernment.
sentences.chinese: 你必须拥有审慎的念住与合理的明辨这个人类价值。

sentences.english: Through conversation, through communication, adults must teach the young, right from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 大人必须通过谈话和沟通教会年轻人明辨是非。

sentences.english: We hope the related countries can respect facts and make a clear distinction between the right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望有关国家尊重事实，明辨是非。

sentences.english: To learn the ability to think and to solve the environmental problems innovatory and independently.
sentences.chinese: 具有创新思考，明辨，构思及独立解决问题的能力。

sentences.english: In religious terms, wisdom is the virtue by which a person can discern the truth and the good from the evil.
sentences.chinese: 宗教将智慧定义为一个人能够明辨是非真伪的美德。

sentences.english: Little children do not know right from wrong.
Open right from wrong, close my eyes to calm thinking.
sentences.chinese: 睁眼明辨是非，闭眼冷静思考。

sentences.english: The first is the right from wrong, make the right choice.
sentences.chinese: 首要的是明辨是非，作出正确选择。

definition: to clarify/to distinguish/to elucidate
to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to explain clearly/to elucidate
to differentiate and analyze/to discriminate
to investigate/to examine closely
sensible/reasonable/an obvious reason, truth or fact/to understand the reason or reasoning
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
true or false?/correct or incorrect/to correct errors (in a document)
to note clearly/to perceive
reason/logic
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
lit. crooked and straight/fig. right and wrong, good and evil
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
